timeline.bodyText:
Can you describe this more, and the implications of a small one and a large one?
Also, what is "size"? rows? bytes?
timeline.author: gpang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1516,6 +1516,13 @@ public String toString() {
           .setConsistencyCheckLevel(ConsistencyCheckLevel.ENFORCE)
           .setScope(Scope.MASTER)
           .build();
+  public static final PropertyKey MASTER_METASTORE_BLOCK_ITERATOR_READAHEAD_SIZE =
+      new Builder(Name.MASTER_METASTORE_BLOCK_ITERATOR_READAHEAD_SIZE)
+          .setDefaultValue("10000")
+          .setDescription("The read-ahead size for block iterator.")

replies.bodyText: I see. Could you update the description to mention bytes, and maybe some of the implications of the size? For example, if we have a billion blocks, is reading 4mb at a time efficient enough? Should this be a larger size?
replies.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: I guess 4MB suffices, as it'd prefetch about 10K inodes and 100K block-Ids. This should be enough as iterator content are ultimately written back to disk.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: below, it uses setPrefixSameAsStart(). We don't need that anymore?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: This one uses RocksIterator.seek() for which this is fine.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: This will put rocks-db to prefix-seek mode. Please see description for more details.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.author: gpang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1516,6 +1516,13 @@ public String toString() {
           .setConsistencyCheckLevel(ConsistencyCheckLevel.ENFORCE)
           .setScope(Scope.MASTER)
           .build();
+  public static final PropertyKey MASTER_METASTORE_BLOCK_ITERATOR_READAHEAD_SIZE =
+      new Builder(Name.MASTER_METASTORE_BLOCK_ITERATOR_READAHEAD_SIZE)
+          .setDefaultValue("10000")

replies.bodyText: I was under impression that it was count, but turns out it's bytes. Made it 4MB to start with.
replies.author: ggezer

timeline.bodyText: after the loop, we should check that the iterator is done?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: should this also use the read option like the other iterator?
timeline.author: gpang
